story: Rob was upset about some things the city council was doing.
Rob was against them instituting permit parking on Rob's street.
Rob organized a petition and collected numerous signatures.
Rob also spoke at several city council meetings.
Thankfully, Rob was able to prevent the measure from being implemented.
Sam saw his brother Barry eating a peanut butter and banana sandwich.
Sam thought it was the grossest thing Sam ever saw.
Barry told Sam to try it himself, but Sam refused.
After many weeks, Sam reluctantly agreed to take a bite.
Sam now eats peanut butter and banana sandwiches every week.
Cindy loves her coworkers but has never attended happy hour with them.
Cindy is afraid it is unprofessional to drink with coworkers.
One day Cindy's best friend at work convinces Cindy to come along.
Cindy goes to happy hour with her coworkers and Cindy's coworkers all drink beer.
Cindy is very pleased that Cindy joined happy hour with Cindy's coworkers.
Larry awakes one night to a sound.
Larry gets up to see if anyone is around.
Larry goes down the stairs into the kitchen.
Larry see's no one just Larry's family kitten.
Larry heads back to bed and rests easily.
Ronald was taking intro to Anatomy.
Ronald was grouped with three beautiful women.
Ronald had no idea what to really expect being sheltered all Ronald's life.
Ronald's face turned bright red as soon as the teacher started speaking.
The group giggled but Ronald learned quite a few things.
Laney hated her job.
Laney's boss was rude and mistreated Laney.
The work was hard and the pay was low.
Finally, one day Laney just quit.
Laney was glad Laney stood up for Laney.
Jen wanted a new bag.
The one Jen wanted was too expensive.
Jen decided to save up.
Jen also took on extra hours.
Jen was happy when Jen was able to buy the bag.
Ray was looking for a birthday present for his mom.
Ray knew his mom had a new interest in fitness and exercise.
Ray asked a fitness instructor and the instructor recommended Fitbit.
Ray went out and bought the Fitbit.
Ray's mom was really surprised and happy with the Fitbit Ray bought.
Paul woke up and began to make his coffee.
Paul hadn't realized, but Paul accidently poured in salt instead of sugar.
Paul didn't take a sip until Paul was on Paul's way to work.
Paul threw the coffee out of the window.
Paul stopped and got another cup of coffee on the way to work.
Kelly got her nails done.
Kelly went to the local salon.
Kelly got them painted red.
The only bad thing was that one of Kelly's broke.
Kelly was so upset.
Emma fell in love with Paul.
Paul didn't feel the same for Emma and rejected Emma.
Emma's feelings were hurt, so Emma told the authorities.
Emma felt even worse when the authorities wouldn't listen.
Emma walked under a mattress for a year to show everyone Emma's feelings.
Phil worked his way up from cook to general manager.
When the owner retired, Phil sold the place to Phil.
Phil found it difficult, running Phil's business.
There were times Phil wished Phil was still just an employee.
Phil kept at it and the place was more popular than before.
Ruth's neighbor was religious.
Ruth's neighbor invited Ruth over for a bible study.
Ruth reluctantly agreed.
Ruth and her neighbor read several passages and discussed them.
When Ruth and her neighbor were done, Ruth went home.
Stan styled his hair like a popular singer.
Stan loved it when girls remarked on the resemblance.
One day, news broke about the popular singer in an embarrassing scandal.
Stan looked at himself in the mirror.
Then Stan got out a razor and shaved off Stan's hair.
Dan dreaded doing back to school shopping with his kids.
However, Dan had to purchase new backpacks and shoes for Emma and Jack.
Dan decided to go to the mall to get the school shopping done.
After looking through several stores, Dan didn't find anything.
Dan was disappointed that Dan did not find anything at the mall.
Gabe rode his bike to school each morning.
One morning Gabe fell off his bike.
Gabe sprained Gabe's ankle.
A neighbor found Gabe and called Gabe's mother.
Gabe's mother picked Gabe up and brought Gabe to the doctor.
Anita browsed the aisles of the local candy store.
There was a container of gummy bears that caught Anita's eye.
Anita hesitated, then discreetly put a handful in Anita's pocket.
The shopkeeper noticed Anita and glared.
Anita never felt so guilty in Anita's life.
John wanted to take Sue to dinner.
John finally got the nerve to ask Sue out.
John called and asked Sue to dinner.
John and Sue decided on a restaurant.
John and Sue had an enjoyable evening.
Sam ran out of gas.
Sam was also wanting a drink.
Sam only had enough money for either beer or gasoline.
Sam decided to get the gasoline and wait on the beer.
It was a smart choice and Sam was proud of Sam.
Ashley bought a dogsled.
Ashley wanted to test it out.
Ashley went outside in the snow.
Ashley climbed to the top of a hill.
Ashley then rode it to the bottom.
Tim had to clean the basement.
Tim's parents told Tim to.
Tim was very angry.
Tim thought the day would be ruined.
However Tim ended up finding Tim's favorite football in the basement.
Rose donned her blue bikini.
It was much smaller than Rose remembered it being.
Or Rose was much larger than Rose had been.
It covered what Rose needed covering, though.
Rose ran out through the snow and jumped into the hot tub.
John had never raced cars professionally before.
John was excited for his first race.
John didn't come close to winning.
John was just glad John got all the way through it.
John knew it was a good first step and continued.
It was Rainer's first time seeing snow.
Rainer was very excited even though Rainer was cold.
Rainer lay down in the snow with her mom.
Rainer moved her arms and legs up and down like her mom showed her.
Rainer thought the snow angels Rainer and her mom made were beautiful.
Tom was a rookie hiker who decided to hike by himself.
Tom was having a great time on a hike Tom had done many times.
Losing track of time, the sun went down, leaving Tom in darkness.
Tom was lost, because everything looked much different at night.
Eventually, Tom found his way home by following the north star.
Emma was letting her toddler play with an heirloom book.
Suddenly, Emma's toddler swiped the book with a marker.
A big blue mark went across the page.
Emma was so worried that Emma's book was permanently ruined.
Luckily, the marker came off with a wet cloth.
Jenna was on her way home from a trip.
Jenna wanted to get home to her boyfriend quickly.
Jenna's sister wanted to stop at the space museum, though.
Jenna impatiently waited as her sister looked through the museum.
Finally, Jenna and her sister got back on the road and went home.
Bobby was at a fast food restaurant.
Bobby poured ketchup from the dispenser.
The ketchup was rancid.
Bobby threw the ketchup away.
Bobby went up to the counter and asked for ketchup packets.
Tom was at the mall.
Tom went into a store and the alarm went off.
Something Tom was wearing set it off.
On the way out an employee asked Tom some questions.
It was clear Tom hadn't stolen and Tom went on Tom's way.
Linah worked at Starbucks.
Linah was expecting Linah's first child.
Linah didn't mind working while pregnant.
Once the baby was born Linah wanted to be a stay at home mother.
Linah quit her job and Linah's husband picked up another job.
Bob and Karen weren't sure what to do on a Fall Friday evening.
Since the big game was the next day, Bob and Karen wanted an early night.
Bob and Karen decided to check out downtown to see what was happening.
At Bob and Karen's surprise, there were a ton of cars downtown!
There wound up being a huge event downtown for Bob and Karen to do!
Katie's mom had twins when Katie was four.
At first Katie hated the twins!
Katie was always being asked to help out.
Katie felt abandoned.
But soon enough, Katie grew to love her baby sisters!
Graham put his new product idea on a crowdfunding site.
Graham raised five thousand dollars for Graham's product idea.
Graham delivered the first of his new product to his customers.
Graham got sued for product infringement.
Graham lost all of Graham's money in the lawsuit.
Bryan is in the third grade.
Bryan does not listen to his parents.
Since Bryan always refuses to do his homework Bryan is behind in school.
Bryan now has to go to a tutor every night.
Bryan has now learned how to do Bryan's math.
Chris had been agoraphobic for years.
Chris had a special worker from the state come and bring Chris things.
Chris became friends and the special worker encouraged Chris to go outside again.
When Chris tried it Chris was amazed at how bright it was outside.
Chris promised his worker he would try it more.
Mary needed to find a dress to wear to her high school prom.
Mary went to many stores and couldn't find a dress Mary liked.
Finally, Mary found a blue dress that looked very pretty.
On prom night, everyone commented on how lovely Mary's dress looked.
Mary felt happy that Mary had such a nice dress.
Neil was ending his visit to Germany.
Neil decided his last sight would be the Black Forest.
Neil took a train ride to the beautiful location.
Neil thought of the German fairy tales set here.
Neil thought the forest was spooky, but beautiful nonetheless!
Dawn and Joyce went for a walk.
It wasn't long till it started raining hard.
Dawn and Joyce took off running to the house.
Dawn and Joyce got so cold and wet.
Dawn and Joyce had to change their clothes.
Tim got a new cat.
The cat always ran from Tim.
Tim bought a bright ball of yarn.
The cat was curious.
Then Tim and Tim's cat played with the yarn together.
Annie remembered standing at this same quilt show last year.
This time around, Annie had a quilt on display.
Annie reflected on all Annie had experienced and accomplished.
The judging had just finished.
Annie had earned an honorable mention ribbon.
Tina had a paper due in two hours.
Only problem was Tina did not start it yet.
Tina then worked very hard for those two hours.
To Tina's delight Tina got a great grade in the end.
Tina could not believe it.
Jamie works almost 7 days a week at his job.
The only thing Jamie has ever wanted was a Jeep Wrangler.
Jamie went home after work on his birthday, his wife was waiting for him.
Jamie's wife stood beside a brand new Jeep with a giant bow on it!
Jamie was so excited, Jamie couldn't wait to go for a ride with Jamie's wife.
Lisa turned thirty-five last weekend.
Lisa's friends threw Lisa surprise birthday party.
Everyone that was close to Lisa attended.
The party became a little too loud and police were called.
Lisa will never forget this birthday party.
John was alone and did not know what to do.
John decided to make a snowman.
John gave the snowman a cool hat.
Then John gave the snowman a huge smile.
At last John did not feel alone anymore!
John realized he had a midterm exam tomorrow.
John had not studied one bit for this exam.
John started cramming for the exam.
John studied for hours into the night.
John barely passed John's midterm that morning.
Jeremy went to his parents house to gather things from his childhood.
In the basement Jeremy found old jars of playdough.
Jeremy tried to play with it but they were solid as a rock.
Jeremy threw the jars away in the trash.
Jeremy went home and bought fresh playdough to replace the old stuff.
Billy was walking in the grass barefoot.
Billy got a thorn in his foot.
Billy screamed in pain.
Billy tried to get it out but Billy couldn't.
Billy's mother finally pulled it out with tweezers.
Kate watched the lotto drawing and checked her ticket.
Kate was shocked to find that Kate had won!
Kate rushed to the lottery office to claim Kate's winnings.
But there, Kate learned that Kate had heard the number wrong.
Kate had not won the jackpot after all.
Brent was in love with Joanna
Joanna's family did not like Brent but they felt Brent was not a good man.
One day brent helped Joanna sneak out of the house but Joanna got caught.
Brent was no longer allowed to see Joanna but Brent knew Brent was wrong.
Joanna eventually met a good man and got married.
Tonya was out shopping with her little girl, Kelsie.
Kelsie saw a bike Kelsie wanted and Tonya agreed to buy it.
Kelsie couldn't wait to get home to ride Kelsie's bike up and down the street.
When Tonya was ready to pay for it, Tonya was ten dollars short.
The person in line behind Tonya paid for the bike and Tonya cried.
Julie was looking for some extra spending money.
Julie decided to open up a lemonade stand.
To Julie's delight the stand became quite popular.
The neighbors wanted to get a taste.
At the end of the day Julie made 100 dollars.
Betty wanted to lose weight.
Betty tried dieting, but that failed.
Betty was unable to give up Betty's favorite sweets .
Then Betty had a better idea!
Betty began walking an hour a day and lost 25 pounds quickly.
Corey got a new job which brought more stress than he was used to.
Corey wanted to keep working but needed a way to deal with the stress.
Corey's friend suggested that Corey start practicing meditation.
Corey researched meditation techniques and found one that worked.
Corey became much less stressed and was happy to keep working.
James was playing video names when he got a bloody nose.
The blood came out quickly, staining James' jeans.
When the bleeding stopped James was left to deal with the mess.
Nothing seemed to get the blood out of James' pants.
Luckily, James' mom took the pants and somehow fixed them.
It was Sue's time to renew her cell phone contract.
Sue was excited about getting the latest phone.
Sue went into the store and found the phone Sue wanted.
With a new contract Sue's phone was only one dollar.
Sue happily paid the one dollar and got a new phone case too.
Doug is drunk.
Doug argues with Doug's son.
Doug fights with Doug's son.
Doug bloodies the face of Doug's son.
Doug gets arrested for Doug's violence.
John was a graphic designer.
John decided to use his skills to make phoney coupons.
John took them to the supermarket and handed them to the cashier.
The coupons made everything in John's cart free.
The cashier did not suspect John and accepted all of the coupons.
Kelly took her sled to the top of the snow-covered hill in the park.
Kelly carefully laid on her belly on the sled.
Slowly, Kelly pushed herself over the crest of the hill.
The sled quickly picked up speed as Kelly glided down the hill.
Kelly laughed all the way to the bottom.
Gina wanted a brand new desk like the new boy in her class.
Gina wanted to ask her teacher, but Gina was helping another student.
As Gina waited, other students were discussing the new desk.
Gina hadn't realized anyone else felt the same way Gina did.
Gina knew if Gina didn't ask first, Gina wouldn't be getting a new desk.
Ted had finals coming up.
Ted knew that Ted did not study enough this semester.
Ted stayed up all late all week studying.
When test day came around Ted was so tired Ted slept all day.
Ted failed all his test, and had to retake all his classes.
Kim had an online diary that she wrote in daily.
Kim was very candid and put everything in the diary.
One day, Kim was very mad at her boss and wrote about it.
Kim soon realized that Kim was not in Kim's diary, but on Facebook!
Everyone saw Kim's post and Kim was fired the next day!
Bobby got into the cheese puffs.
Bobby's mother told Bobby to wait until after dinner, but Bobby couldn't.
Bobby thought Bobby'd gotten away with it.
Then Bobby realized Bobby had bright orange cheese all over Bobby's fingers.
Bobby's mother didn't let Bobby have dessert that night as punishment.
Fernando wanted to capture the majestic beauty of the Alps.
Fernando bought a ticket to go up the mountain.
On top, it was so cold that Fernando's hands were shaking.
When it was time to take the pictures Fernando wanted, Fernando couldn't.
Fernando all came shaky and unfocused.
Lucy was eating in the dark.
Lucy was depressed.
Lucy ate cold chicken and went to bed.
Lucy left the bones and the crumbs on the table.
The next day Lucy's grandma scolded Lucy for leaving a mess.
Kelly liked the boy that sat next to her in class.
Kelly decided to ask the boy out one day.
The boy told Kelly that he wasn't interested, but the boy was just shy.
After a week the boy told Kelly the truth and the boy went out.
Kelly and the boy are now dating and Kelly and the boy are both happy.
Holly had always wanted to pursue a Master's in Public Health.
Holly worked hard academically to maintain a good grade point average.
Holly also interned with the local Health Department to gain experience.
During Holly's senior year Holly was able to apply to graduate schools.
Holly's internships and grades earned Holly a spot in graduate school!
Tom wanted to buy a gun.
Tom decided to go to the shooting range.
Tom figured it would be a good place to learn about guns.
Everyone Tom talked to was an idiot.
It made Tom rethink Tom's gun culture.
Lagertha didn't like being told what to do.
Lagertha's mother told Lagertha to clean Lagertha's room.
Lagertha refused, and went outside to play with Lagertha's friends.
When Lagertha returned at dusk, there was candy and roast lamb to eat.
Lagertha's mother forbid her to have any though, and sent her to her room.
Gina's mom had been slowly packing her mother's things.
Gina's mom was taking her mother to Minnesota with Gina's mom.
Gina helped Gina's mom every once in awhile.
Today Gina had nothing else to do.
Gina decided to spend 3 hours helping with the packing.
Nellie fell asleep on the sand at the beach.
Nellie dozed peacefully for a few hours.
But when Nellie woke, Nellie panicked.
Nellie was covered head-to-toe in heavy wet sand!
Nellie's little brother had buried Nellie in sand while Nellie slept!
Last summer was incredibly hot.
My friend Dalton spent almost the whole summer in Dalton's house.
There was one day where Dalton spent all day at my house though.
It was the day that Dalton's air conditioner broke.
I sort of wish Dalton's air conditioner had broken more often.
Frank was a pitcher for a MLB team.
But last season Frank got hurt and had to receive Tommy John surgery.
Frank was scared Frank would not pitch again.
But after a year and a half Frank came back to pitch again.
Frank was once again a pitcher for a MLB team.
Daniel loves filling the bird feeders at his home.
Daniel enjoys seeing the wide variety of birds that they attract.
The birds glare at Daniel through the window if they are not fed.
When Daniel fills the feeders, the birds alert their friends by chirping.
After fresh food is supplied, Daniel loves seeing the birds so happy.
Alex was told by his parents to not mess with their computer at all.
One day when Alex's parents had to run errands Alex was left at home.
Alex decided to go on Alex's parents computer since Alex's parents weren't home.
Alex ended up messing up his parents' passwords.
Alex's parents came home and saw what Alex had done they grounded Alex.
Anna went on a class trip.
Anna went to Thailand and Malaysia.
Anna had jet lag, but quickly overcame it.
Then Anna explored the sights with her classmates.
Anna had an amazing time!
Sarah loves the winter.
One of Sarah's favorite things about this time is the trees.
Sarah loves watching the snow pile on the branches.
Sarah stared out the window all winter.
Sarah is a peaceful person because of it.
Lisa had a house cat Ruffles.
Ruffles always stayed inside.
One day Ruffles wanted to go outside.
Ruffles walked out.
Luckily Lisa caught Ruffles in time.
Bill worked at a bank as a loan officer.
Bill embezzled a large amount of money from the bank.
Bank auditors discovered the discrepancy.
Bill was convicted and sent to prison.
The authorities never found Bill's money.
Lisa was a phenomenal athlete.
Lisa won a gold medal in the Olympics.
Lisa was training to compete in the next Olympics as well.
Every day after practice, Lisa'd look at Lisa's gold medal.
Lisa was determined to win another one.
Donna's son kept getting into trouble and was suspended from school.
Donna's son eventually had to spend a month in juvenile detention.
That month made a huge change in Donna's son's attitude.
Donna's son graduated from high school on time and found a full-time job.
Donna is very relieved at the turnaround Donna's son has made.
Anna wanted to make pasta for dinner.
Anna set Anna's noodles to boil.
But Anna forgot to watch her noodles!
By the time Anna remembered, it was too late.
The Anna's noodles were overcooked and mushy.
Ray worked in the fashion industry.
Every season, Ray needs a new suit to keep up with style.
Last autumn, Ray tried a suit that was radical looking.
Ray knew it was a risk to wear it in Ray's industry.
The risk paid off, and Ray started a new trend altogether.
Randy was eating his favorite steak.
While eating Randy felt a pain in his chest.
Randy grabbed his chest and fell to the floor.
Randy's kids came over to check on Randy.
They rushed Randy to the hospital where Randy made a full recovery.
Tim was allergic to peanuts.
Tim was out eating at a restaurant.
Tim asked them if there were any in Tim's food.
They told Tim there wasn't but Tim still had an allergic reaction.
Tim is now suing the restaurant for medical costs.
Gina prepared food for the family.
Gina cooked lasagna, grilled chicken and garlic bread.
As soon as we started to eat, Gina's mom became nauseous.
Afterwards, everyone started to feel queasy.
Gina eventually threw away the food and ordered Chinese food.
Kim's lips felt dry.
Kim got some lip gloss that promised to make Kim's lips moist.
Kim slathered it on and rubbed Kim's lips together.
Kim felt a horrible tingling and burning.
Kim was allergic to the gloss!
Marissa is turning 16 this year.
Marissa's parents are planning a sweet 16.
Her parents are going to surprise Marissa.
Then Marissa's parents will be holding the party at Marissa's parents' house.
The party was a success Marissa was in shock with Marissa's party.
Dina is getting married in two weeks.
Dina's friend Colleen is serving as Dina's maid of honor.
Dina is getting a little bit nervous as the date approaches.
Colleen is helping calm Dina's fears by being supportive.
Dina hopes Dina is not so nervous on the actual day of the wedding.
Sarah always wanted to have a pet cat.
Sarah's mom knew Sarah was too young for Sarah's own pet.
Instead of a cat, Sarah's mom bought Sarah a goldfish.
Sarah named Sarah's fish Cat.
It looks like Sarah got a pet Cat after all.
Adam was expecting an important phone call.
Adam carried Adam's phone with Adam all day.
Adam was surprised in the evening nobody called.
Adam checked Adam's phone.
It was on silent mode.
Sally and Tommy saw a family of Syrian refugees on TV.
Sally and Tommy were sad and wanted to help.
Sally and Tommy decided to have a lemonade stand.
Sally and Tommy sold lemonade all day Saturday.
Tommy and Sally felt glad Tommy and Sally raised fifty two dollars.
Tim woke up early one day.
Tim decided to eat cereal before work.
After taking a bite Tim realized it was stale.
Tim decided Tim didn't care.
Tim kept eating it after it soaked in the milk a bit.
Tom thought about his health often.
Tom would wash Tom's hands 30 times per day.
Tom visited a psychologist about this.
The psychologist helped Tom significantly.
Tom no longer washed Tom's hands excessively.
Ben had a huge collection of video games.
Ben's favourite was Rocket League.
Ben got so good at it, that Ben's team entered a competition.
Ben's team tried hard at the competition, but everyone else was too good.
Ben's team got knocked out very early.
Charles was about twenty years older than the kids on the court.
But Charles knew moves with a basketball they couldn't imagine.
During a game this summer the score was tied.
Charles had the ball and Charles' team needed one basket to win.
Charles pretended to be nervous and then sunk a jump shot!
Joe was going to the new restaurant with his coworkers for lunch.
Joe sent some discount coupons out to Joe's workplace.
Joe's coworkers offered some quick and cheap lunch options.
It was also very close to Joe's work.
Joe hoped it would be his new lunch place to go to.
Tim was trying to wash dishes.
Tim noticed the water wouldn't drain.
Tim tried using a plunger to fix it.
After a bit of trying the water started to leave.
Tim plunged a bit more just to make sure.
Robbie wanted a pet cat.
Robbie's parents took Robbie to the Humane Society to choose one.
Robbie looked at all of the cats in the cages.
Finally, Robbie chose a black and grey cat.
Robbie and Robbie's parents took the new pet cat home.
Phil had always wanted to see Ireland for himself.
Phil saved up money for a big trip.
Finally it was time for Phil to fly to Ireland.
Phil tried the local food and met many people.
Phil was happy that Phil had finally visited Ireland.
Mary had a diary which she used to store her personal thoughts.
Mary's brother came into Mary's room and snooped around.
Mary's brother found Mary's diary and started reading it.
After some time, Mary's brother felt a pang of guilt.
Mary's brother returned the diary to its hiding spot.
Eric referees high school football.
Every Friday, there is a new game and a new experience.
This Friday, the top two teams in the state are playing.
Everyone is abuzz about the game.
Eric can not wait to referee the game.
Sadie was at her high school prom with her boyfriend.
Sadie was thrilled when she learned that she was prom queen.
Unfortunately Sadie's boyfriend was not the prom king.
While Sadie was thrilled, she didn't want to dance with another guy.
Sadie decided to pass on the crown and another girl took Sadie's spot.
Marcus noticed that he got dizzy when he got up in the morning.
Marcus wasn't old enough for that to be normal, so Marcus called his doctor.
The doctor hemmed and hawed for a few minutes.
Then Marcus suggested Marcus drink more water every day.
Marcus followed the doctor's advice and that solved the problem.
There was a clown at Eddy's friend's birthday party.
Eddy couldn't get over how big the clown's feet were.
Eddy asked his mom if people had to have big feet to be clowns.
Eddy's mom laughed at his question.
Eddy's mom told Eddy that they wore big shoes, but they didn't have extra big feet.
Miranda needed to go to the store.
Miranda was searching but could not find any clean clothes.
Soon Miranda's search began to run long and Miranda grew impatient.
Miranda decided to throw on one of her boyfriend's shirts.
Luckily Miranda liked the shirt and enjoyed wearing her boyfriend's things.
Cameron went to the playground.
Cameron noticed that one of Cameron's friends was crying.
Cameron asked his friend if he could help his friend.
Cameron's friend wanted to play on the see-saw.
Cameron agreed to help Cameron's friend by playing on the see-saw.
Gina had always wanted to be in the circus.
The trapeze was Gina's real goal.
One day, Gina saw an ad for trapeze lessons!
Gina signed up and couldn't wait for class to begin.
Gina had waited her whole life for this!
Shelley and Hopkins were about to get into an argument.
It was about Shelley having insulted Hopkins' culture.
Shelley clarified that Shelley had been misunderstood.
Hopkins laughed about the misunderstanding.
The two avoided the argument and had a pleasant evening together.
Madi was hanging out with her little sister while mom took a shower.
Madi glanced over to the table and noticed a pair of scissors.
Then Madi looked at her sister's hair and saw how long it was getting.
Madi grabbed the scissors and cut Emma's hair to Emma's jawline.
When mom got downstairs, she was sad to see her sister's first haircut.
Eric walked through the city park on his way to a bar.
Eric was in a hurry so Eric decided to take a shortcut.
Eric hopped over the fence and cut across the grass.
A park ranger saw this and yelled at Eric.
Eric ran off and hoped that Eric was not being chased.
Edna had taken her toddler to the doctor.
In the office, Edna's toddler was playing with some toys.
The doctor noticed that Edna's toddler really liked one toy.
Edna told Edna that Edna's son could keep the toy if Edna's son wanted.
Edna thanked the doctor and the baby took the toy home.
David had been in business for 10 Years.
David didn't understand why a new business was selling more than David.
David asked the new business owner what was his secret.
The owner told David the secret to success is online marketing.
So David paid an SEO firm to put David on the front page of Google.
Brad was a quick learner at the school of music in his city.
Brad was the ideal student to have and many of Brad's teachers agreed.
Brad was a fast learner and could play any instrument they had.
Brad became the next Beethoven and went on to write many compositions.
Brad was a genius composer and owed his success to his school of music.
John wanted to do well in school.
John was struggling.
John hired a tutor.
The tutor helped John.
John's grades improved.
Mickey wanted strawberry ice cream.
The ice cream shop was out of strawberry ice cream.
Mickey had to choose between chocolate and vanilla.
Mickey decided on chocolate.
Mickey was less than satisfied with Mickey's ice cream.
Lola was planning to go to the beach with her husband.
Lola told Lola's relatives that Lola would go to the beach.
Lola's aunt told Lola that she would also come.
However, Lola and Max had a fight before the trip.
Lola felt very bad that Lola couldn't realize Lola's plans.
Mike turned 21 Year's old one summer day.
When Mike woke up, Mike put on some clothes and left Mike's house.
Mike drove down to the local grocery store and bought some beers.
Mike was very nervous to go home and actually try one.
When Mike finally got home, Mike drank the alcohol but became too drunk.
Bill put money into the stock market.
Bill invested all of Bill's money in Apple.
Apple's stocks went up $300 in one day!
Bill sold Bill's stocks and made millions!
Bill lived a life of luxury after that day.
Allie was driving only five miles above the limit.
All the sudden Allie got pulled over.
When Allie saw the cop she was awestruck.
The cop was very beautiful.
Thankfully the cop let Allie go with a warning.
Sam loved to fish.
Sam would go out onto the lake often.
One day Sam caught a huge fish!
Sam took Sam's eyes off it for one second and it flopped away!
Sam wanted the fish so badly Sam dived in after it!
Charles notices his hands are a little dirty after working all day.
Charles decides to wash them when Charles gets home.
Charles washes Charles' hands thoroughly.
Charles' hands are clean now.
Charles is glad Charles washed Charles' hands.
Jason woke up to the sound of water.
It was coming from Jason's basement.
Jason went down to the basement to see what was happening.
The basement was totally flooded from a leak!
Jason called a plumber to fix everything.
Maggie had been in trouble with the law when she was younger.
When Maggie married and had a kid, Maggie was a great mom.
Maggie and her husband divorced and her husband filed for custody.
The judge held Maggie's past against her and ruled for her husband.
Maggie, despondent, fell back into a life of crime.
Lori was watching her aunt's house.
Lori decided to borrow her aunt's new car.
When Lori was parking she crashed.
Lori ran right into the garage door.
There were a lot of Lori's damages.
Mark entered his work in the art fair.
The judges chose one piece to display in the main tent.
It attracted a big crowd.
Mark decided to sell it to someone.
Mark made $10,000 on the one piece!
Eugene needed extra money.
Eugene decided to be a dog walker.
Eugene would go to people's homes while they were at work.
Eugene'd walk their dogs until they were tired.
Eugene liked being outdoors and working with animals.
Mary decided to take a bath.
Mary turned on water and sat into the tub.
While Mary put shampoo on her hair she saw spider.
Mary got scared.
Mary run away from bathtub naked.
Joel was very stingy with his money.
And Joel always feared Joel would need to use it for an emergency.
Joel never took vacations or bought things for Joel.
But Joel kept on saving money.
Joel felt regretful for never spending more after Joel retired.
Becky wanted to impress her pals.
Becky showed her pals her dad's prized collection of rocks.
When Becky's pals begged, Becky let Becky's pals each keep a rock.
The pals left, and Becky looked at the empty spaces in her dad's collection.
Becky walked along the road picking up rocks to fill the spaces.
Cody had really nice skin until he was about 8 years old.
Shortly after Cody's 8th birthday Cody's skin began to itch.
As time went on Cody's skin began to peel and it would cause Cody pain.
Cody went to the Doctor who ordered tests which showed Cody had eczema.
Cody was then prescribed special lotions and now Cody's skin is better.
